page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: Bishops Waltham once had a fine {railway station}connecting us to nearby towns along the Meon Valley. But nowadays it no longer exists and we only have{buses and cars}to go from place to place. Bus services to such places as Fareham and Winchester are{infrequent and{cost a lot}of money. Bishops Waltham has a coach service called {Glider Service. More recently local people raised funds for the{Bishops Waltham Minibus which is needed mainly to transport the{elderly}and is hired by other local groups and clubs for outings etc. Other transport like{motorbikes and{bicycles}are fairly usual but lorries we only see now if passing by or carrying supplies.
